intro: Huberopappus, commonly known as the desert aster, is a genus of flowering plants native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plants typically have hairy stems and leaves adapted to withstand drought conditions. They produce showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to purple, often blooming in late spring or early summer. Huberopappus species are generally low-growing shrubs or herbs, with small, linear leaves and a compact growth habit.
